messages.message:
Encountered some interesting behavior in a conversation--I was just testing some UI things and sending essentially a useless prompt, and the model initially replied conversationally, so I also replied conversationally to see what would happen. And it just spent about 30 seconds rerunning through an entire query I’d sent previously. The answer is also slightly wrong, but that’s a separate issue.

(This is on prod, v25.18.5 fwiw.)

@Rosie can you share the entire thread here?

@jayasooryan
This is the conversation itself, not sure if you have access: https://aihub.instabase.com/converse/019644d1-eb4b-7dd8-9389-442eea4df2ad, it’s in the ib-internal organization.
It’s just one of my testing conversations so feel free to ignore the first few messages :sweat_smile:
I don't see the prompts, can you share the list of prompts used for testing?

The other week I sent:
1. `Extract the permissions table related to automation projects and apps`
2. `Extract the permissions table related to automation projects and apps in Assigning roles.pdf`
3. `Extract the permissions table related to automation projects and apps in Assigning roles.pdf, formatted as a table`
4. `Extract the permissions table related to automation projects and apps in Assigning roles.pdf, formatted as a table, rendering checkmarks as "Yes" and dashes as "No"`
5. `Extract the permissions table related to automation projects and apps in Assigning roles.pdf, formatted as a Markdown table, rendering checkmarks as "Yes" and dashes as "No"`
(I was _reallllly_ trying to get the model to correctly interpret every checkmark in the table)

Then today I sent:
6. `abc`
7. `sorry i was testing a button`

The surprise response seems to be an exact copy of the response to question 5, which was the most recent query prior to my two nonsensical prompts
It is related to the conversational memory. We do have guardrails to handle it. Need to deep dive on this
